review:
I was skeptical about this, especially considering how inexpensive it is. I've used it four times now, and I've had zero issues, each time. (For those who said theirs beeped, incessantly, upon plugging it in, I don't know what to tell you. Mine didn't do that.)

The cooker uses a miniscule amount of water, and it hard "boils" the eggs in only 14 minutes, whether it's cooking 1-7 eggs. They have come out perfectly cooked, each time!

Some things to consider:

- Capacity is seven "large or smaller size eggs". I have only used jumbo size eggs. Per the instructions, the sides of the eggs aren't supposed to touch, but with six jumbo eggs, that's impossible, once you place the dome lid on top. I don't think you could even fit seven jumbo eggs in it. I've made six, but not seven, at a time, and the sides were touching each time. The world didn't end, so that's that. 

- You pierce the wider end of the egg with the spike, that's on the bottom of the measuring cup and place them thin side down, on the tray. When done, every egg has had a flat side, on the egg whites. No big deal if you're simply going to eat them. If you're going for aesthetics, it's something to think about.

- Instructions say 14 minutes cook time for hard boiled, but for jumbo eggs, it's closer to 15 or even 16 minutes. You're mileage may vary. 

- I have no idea how loud the chime is, when it's finished, as I set the oven timer to go off anyway.

- I have used neither the egg separator, nor the omelet tray. They may work. They may be junk. I do not know. 

Yes, the thing may break tomorrow, but at $9, it's no big deal. I'll simply go by another one. With that said, I can't see how you'll be disappointed, if you go buy one, for yourself. Do it!
